thread.title: Keith Richards' Bentley and other vintage motors up for auction
thread.title_full: Keith Richards' Bentley and other vintage motors up for auction

title: Keith Richards' Bentley and other vintage motors up for auction
text: Goodwood Revival Auction 2015: Your chance to own Keith Richards' car By Zahra Jamshed, CNN Updated 0441 GMT (1141 HKT) September 3, 2015 15 photos: This year's stellar catalog of vintage motors 1966 Ferrari 275 GTB/6C Alloy (previously owned by Chris Evans) – From Top Gear host Chris Evans' fleet of Ferraris and Jaguars to Keith Richards' 1965 Bentley, the upcoming auction (set for September 12) is all-star. Hide Caption 15 photos: This year's stellar catalog of vintage motors 1971 Ferrari 365GTS/4 "Daytona" Spider (previously owned by Chris Evans) – $3.5 million - 3.9 million Hide Caption 15 photos: This year's stellar catalog of vintage motors 1963 Ferrari 250 GT Lusso Berlinetta – $2.1 million - 2.7 million Hide Caption 15 photos: This year's stellar catalog of vintage motors 1953 Bentley R-Type 4.9 Litre Continental Sports Saloon – $1.2 million - 1.5 million Hide Caption 15 photos: This year's stellar catalog of vintage motors 1965 Bentley S3 Continental Flying Spur Sports Saloon (previously owned by Keith Richards) – $600,000 - 900,000 Hide Caption 15 photos: This year's stellar catalog of vintage motors 1938 BMW 328 GP – $850,000 - 950,000 Hide Caption 15 photos: This year's stellar catalog of vintage motors 1960 Scarab-Offenhauser Formula 1/Intercontinental Formula Racing Single-Seater – $1 million - 1.5 million Hide Caption 15 photos: This year's stellar catalog of vintage motors 1977 Ferrari Boxer – $300,000 - 400,000 Hide Caption 15 photos: This year's stellar catalog of vintage motors 1970 Porsche 908 – $3.4 million - 3.8 million Hide Caption 15 photos: This year's stellar catalog of vintage motors 1927 Amilcar C6 – $380,000 - 450,000 Hide Caption 15 photos: This year's stellar catalog of vintage motors 1993 Ferrari F40 Berlinetta – $1 million - $1.2 million Hide Caption 15 photos: This year's stellar catalog of vintage motors 1935 Aston Martin Ulster – $1 million - 1.4 million Hide Caption 15 photos: This year's stellar catalog of vintage motors 1937/9 BMW 328 – $300,000 - 400,000 Hide Caption 15 photos: This year's stellar catalog of vintage motors 1973 Porsche 911S 2.4-Litre Coupe – $350,000 - 450,000 Hide Caption 15 photos: This year's stellar catalog of vintage motors 1961 Jaguar E-Type – 75,000 - 90,000 Hide Caption 15 of 15 Keith Richards' "Blue Lena," a beautiful 1965 Bentley S3 Continental "Flying Spur," and 13 of Chris Evans' vintage motors will be included in this year's Goodwood Revival Auction on September 12. Evans, the new host of British television program Top Gear , will be selling off several highly prized Ferraris, including the rare right-hand drive 1966 Ferrari 275 GTB/6C Alloy, the 1971 Ferrari 365 GTS/4 "Daytona" Spider and the 1964 Ferrari 250 GT/L "Lusso." Richards wrote about "Blue Lena" in his 2010 autobiography saying, "My dark blue Bentley, my S3 Continental Flying Spur -- an automobile of some rarity, one of a limited edition of 87. Having this car was already heading for trouble, breaking the rules of the establishment, driving a car I was definitely not born in to. 'Blue Lena' had carried us on many an acid-fuelled journey." Speed junkies can also get behind the wheels of racing classics, including an original Scarab-Offenhauser Formula 1 single-seater from 1960 and a 1970 Porsche 908/03 Sports Racing Prototype. With estimated prices ranging from £50,000 to over £6 million ($76,000 - $9 million), this year's auction includes stand out models from the likes of Jaguar, Ferrari, BMW, Porsche and more. Take a look at some of the highlights in the gallery above. More from Autos
